newsitem.title: USA: State Street wants to stay independent.
newsitem.headline: State Street wants to stay independent.

text.p: State Street Boston Corp, responding to news that Bank of New York Co Inc has accumulated a 4.99 percent stake and wants to raise it, said Thursday the State Street board believes the company should remain independent.
State Street Boston also said it was reaffirming its commitment to delivering long-term shareholder value.

"We will take all appropriate steps to ensure that we can implement our (strategic) plan so that all shareholders can continue to participate in our success," State Street Boston Chairman and Chief Executive Marshall Carter said in a statement.

Earlier Thursday, Bank of New York said in a press release that it filed applications with the Federal Reserve Board and the Massachusetts Board of Bank Incorporation seeking approval to raise its stake in State Street to 9.9 percent. The stake was 4.00 percent on September 30.
